The claim was made by Marie Ghazal: the chief executive officer of the Rhode Island Free Clinic, a reputable nonprofit organization that treats the uninsured population in Rhode Island. This adds credibility to the claim as it is coming from an expert in the field.
The claim was based on information obtai: which referenced a map developed by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The CDC is a reliable source of health-related data and statistics, further supporting the authenticity of the claim.
The CDC: s map categorizes states into three groups based on the proportion of people with health insurance: those with the highest, lowest, and those in between. Rhode Island falls into the "in-between" category, which suggests that it has a significant percentage of uninsured adults compared to other states in New England.
While specific numbers were not provided: further investigation was conducted by the experts to obtain state-by-state numbers through the Behavioral Risk Factor Surveillance System, a reliable telephone survey that counts the number of people without health insurance. This additional effort to verify the claim adds to its authenticity.
